com.bws.jdistil.core.datasource.database
Class DbUtil

java.lang.Object
  com.bws.jdistil.core.datasource.database.DbUtil

public class DbUtil
extends java.lang.Object

Utility class providing database related services for opening connections, closing connections, committing and rolling back transactions, closing SQL statements and result sets, retrieving data as different data types from a SQL result set and setting SQL parameters of different data types in a prepared SQL statement.

Author:
- Bryan Snipes

getCondition

public static java.lang.String getCondition(java.lang.String columnName,
                                            int columnType,
                                            java.lang.String value,
                                            java.lang.String wildCards,
                                            boolean convertLowerCase,
                                            boolean isOracle)
                                     throws DataSourceException
Returns a SQL condition using a given column name, column type, value, a string containing valid wildcard characters, and an Oracle database indicator.  Column type must be a valid type defined by the java.sql.Types class. Example 1: getCondition("customer.name", Types.VARCHAR, "J*hn Smith", "*", true, false) returns: "customer.name like \'j%hn smith\'" Example 2: getCondition("customer.birth_date", Types.DATE, "10/X2/2%X1", "*XY", true, true) returns: "to_char(customer.birth_date, 'mm-dd-yyyy') like '10-%-%'"

Parameters:
columnName - - Database column name. example: "table_name.column_name"
columnType - - Column types based on constants in java.sql.Types.
value - - Value that the user entered.
wildCards - - Additional wildcards (besides %).
convertLowerCase - - Lower case return value indicator.
isOracle - - Oracle database indicator.
Returns:
String - SQL condition.
Throws:
com.bws.jdistil.core.util.DataSourceException
DataSourceException

executeQuery

public static MappedResult executeQuery(java.lang.String name,
                                        java.lang.String sqlString)
                                 throws DataSourceException
Creates and executes a query defined by a SQL string and returns a mapped result object encapsulating the results.

Parameters:
sqlString - - SQL query string.
Returns:
MappedResult - Mapped result object.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException
DataSourceException
